greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 3-adic valuation of A005130(n).
comment: 3^a(n) is the highest power of 3 dividing A005130(n).
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: s[n_] := Plus @@ IntegerDigits[n, 3]; a[0] = 0; a[n_] := a[n] = a[n - 1] + (s[2*n - 2] + s[2*n - 1] - s[n - 1] - s[3*n - 2])/2; Array[a, 101, 0] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Feb 21 2021 *)
program: (MAGMA) A005130:=func<i | IsZero(i) select 1 else &*[Factorial(3*k+1)/Factorial(i+k): k in [0..i-1]]>; [Valuation(A005130(n),3): n in [0..100]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Aug 05 2013
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 04 2013, based on a suggestion from Victor H. Moll.
